results.title: Mechanical aptitudes
results.brief_description: Illustrates ways to test the mechanical interests and abilities of a student. A high school counsellor explains that the vocational field selected is not always entirely suited to the talents of the student. A student undergoes a series of test to find a course of study best suited to his interests, abilities and future plans. Different departments of training for a student interested in a given field are illustrated.

results.title: Measuring the Univese
results.brief_description: Explains how astronomers measure the brightness of stars and calculate their distance from Earth. Stars are classified by the spectrums their light produces, and this real brightness in conjunction with the apparent brightness enables measurement - even of stars outside our own galaxy.
results.description: Explains how astronomers measure the brightness of stars and calculate their distance from Earth. results.title: Measuring short distances
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Starts with the centimetre scale, moves on to microscopic dimensions and then to the dimensions of atoms by means of Erwin Mueller’s field emission microscope. Shows how calibration of instruments can give us accurate knowledge of these small distances.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Educational Services Incorporated and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Measurement with light waves
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: This film explains the principles of measurement with light waves, the nature of light waves; the reflection and refraction of monochromatic light by a glass surface; the use of these bands in ultra-precision measurement; and their translation into millionths of an inch. The film then goes on to demonstrate the procedures in gauge block inspection, the comparison of gauge blocks for height; the meaning of circular and parallel bands on gauge surfaces; the precautions necessary in measurement with light waves; and the inspection procedures followed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Measurement in the metal working industry. No.4. Verniers
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the principles of the vernier scale, and its application to precision measurment, using animation and direct photography. The care of vernier-scaled tools is emphasised; particular care must be taken of such tools if they are to maintain their accuracy.

results.title: Measurement in the metal working industry. No. 2. Micrometer
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: An explanation of the basic principles on which the micrometer works: correct care, use and maintenance of a micrometer; the various types of micrometers developed to measure outside lengths, inside lengths and depths.
